title: 111_hr6235
content: The National Blue Alert Act of 2010 establishes a national Blue Alert communications network within the Department of Justice to disseminate information when a law enforcement officer is seriously injured or killed in the line of duty. The Attorney General will coordinate with States, local governments, and law enforcement agencies to promote local Blue Alert plans. The Attorney General appoints a Department of Justice officer as the national coordinator of the Blue Alert communications network. The Coordinator's duties include working with States to develop Blue Alert plans and establishing guidelines for their implementation. The Blue Alert plan includes criteria for issuing alerts, guidelines to protect the privacy of law enforcement officers, and procedures for confirming injuries or deaths in the line of duty. The Blue Alert plan includes guidelines for providing information on seriously injured or killed law enforcement officers to the National Crime Information Center database and relevant state crime repositories. The Blue Alert plan involves limiting alerts to specific geographic areas for suspect apprehension, seamless communication between state law enforcement agencies, and inclusion of information in relevant crime databases. The Blue Alert plan includes guidelines for issuing alerts through the Blue Alert communications network and protocols for apprehending suspects from initial notification to apprehension. The Blue Alert plan involves issuing alerts through the Blue Alert communications network, coordinating with states, and establishing an advisory group for promoting Blue Alert plans. The Blue Alert communications network includes representatives from various organizations and individuals deemed necessary for its success. The network serves as a nationwide point of contact for developing the network and coordinating alerts for law enforcement officers. The Blue Alert network is for law enforcement officers injured or killed in the line of duty. Guidelines and duties are voluntary for states, with a focus on disseminating information on assaults or injuries. The Blue Alert network disseminates information on assaults or injuries to law enforcement officers. Guidelines ensure compliance with privacy laws and protect the civil liberties of officers and their families. The Coordinator cooperates with other agencies like the Secretary of Homeland Security. The Coordinator collaborates with various agencies to implement activities under the Act. Reports on the effectiveness of Blue Alert plans in each State are submitted to Congress annually. SEC. 4. GRANT PROGRAM FOR SUPPORT OF BLUE ALERT PLANS. The Attorney General will provide grants to States for the development or enhancement of programs and activities to support Blue Alert plans and the Blue Alert communications network. Activities funded by the grants may include education and training programs, law enforcement programs, new technologies for improved communications, and other activities deemed appropriate by the Attorney General. The Attorney General will provide grants for Blue Alert communications network support. Federal share not to exceed 50%. Grants distributed equitably throughout the US regions. Attorney General to set grant requirements. The term "State" in this Act refers to each of the 50 states, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, the US Virgin Islands, Guam, American Samoa, the Northern Mariana Islands, and federally recognized Indian tribes. Authorization of appropriations is granted. Authorization of appropriations is granted for the Act, with funds available for grants in fiscal year 2011 totaling $10,000,000. Amounts appropriated shall remain available until expended.
